thread.title: Man attacked, robbed while attempting to deliver food in Bronx
thread.title_full: Man attacked, robbed while attempting to deliver food in Bronx

author: THOMAS TRACY
title: Man attacked, robbed while attempting to deliver food in Bronx
text:
SEE IT: Man attacked, robbed while attempting to make food delivery in the Bronx Man attacked, robbed while attempting to deliver food in Bronx NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Tuesday, February 21, 2017, 8:40 AM 
Cops are searching for a couple who viciously beat and robbed a 21-year-old man making a food delivery in the Bronx. 
Startling surveillance video released Tuesday shows the duo forcing their victim onto the ground, yanking off his jacket and shirt and punching and kicking him inside the lobby of building on a Olinville Ave. near Britton St. in Allerton about 11 p.m. on Feb. 2, cops said. 
The victim had just entered the lobby of the apartment building when the woman began shoving him, the video shows. Her accomplice quickly joined in, throwing a flurry of haymakers and kicks at the delivery man, bringing him to the ground. 
During the struggle, the two pulled off the victimâ€™s jacket and shirt and went through his pockets, taking some cash and an iPhone 5S, officials said. 
Girl Scout robbed at gunpoint, police buy cookies to cover loss 
They then threw the victims clothes back at him and walk off, ignoring the food, officials said. Cops are looking for two suspects who allegedly attacked a robbed a delivery man in a Bronx building. (Handout) 
The victim suffered minor injuries, officials said. 
The male suspects is described as black with a thin build. He was wearing a black jacket, blue hoodie, camouflage pants and black boots. His accomplice was last seen wearing a gray hoodie, navy blue pants and black shoes. 
Anyone with information is asked to call CrimeStoppers at (800) 577-TIPS. All calls will be kept confidential. Join the Conversation:
